column1: Depends on Report Export : Report Export Application : Export Search as CSV

column3: Ensure you have exported at least one CSV from the search results as per the "Export Search as CSV" test

Go to the report search page.  This can be found at the bottom of the admin left navigation.

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//admin/reports

column4: The page lists all the reports that have been generated by any user

column3: Select an "application" report, and click on "Search again"

column4: The application search page opens with the same filters as the report you selected (but not necessarily the same results)

column3: Go back to the report search page
Select a report, and click on "Download report"

column4: A download box appears for the CSV file
The filename reflects the name you gave the export and the date requested

column3: Save the CSV to your computer
Open the CSV in a spreadsheet program

column4: The CSV contains the data that was displayed in the search results
The CSV is the "admin" CSV, not the "public" CSV.  You can tell this because the final 3 columsn include account information

column3: Go back to the report search page
Try out the facets and the sorting and searching options on this page

column4: The page works as expected, and you can find the report you are looking for
